intro: Unisema media, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and large, vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants. Unisema media typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable species for ecological studies.
